subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|尸|米|ls=ic|t1=body|t2=rice}}. The {{lang|zh|米}} component was originally three to five dots (four dots was the most common one; faeces coming out of the backside) in the [[oracle bone script]], thus representing a man defecating.

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|一垺屎|一礐屎|一粒老鼠屎，壞了一鍋粥|半桶屎|厚屎|厚屎尿|厚話屎|好好鱟刣甲屎那流|家己捧屎抹面|屎|屎堆|屎尾|屎尿|屎㞎㞎|屎忽|屎忽鬼|屎桮齒|屎桶|屎殼郎|屎盎|屎礐仔|屎礐仔蟲|屎窟|屎缸蟲|屙屎|慢牛厚屎尿|懶人多屎尿|拉屎|拖屎連|搞屎棍|搦屎搦尿|擔屎|攝屎|放屎|桌頂食飯，桌跤放屎|流目屎|滲屎|滲屎尿|漚屎面|激屎|火屎|炭屎|牛屎色|牛屎鳥仔|牛屎龜|狗屎|狗改不了吃屎|生狂狗食無屎|生雞卵無，放雞屎有|疶屎|目屎|目屎膏|眼屎|瞪屎|老鼠屎|耳屎|胡蠅屎痣|胡蠅舞屎桮|落屎|落屎星|落屎馬|薰屎|話屎|雞屎落塗，也有三寸煙|雞屎運|鼻屎|鼻屎膏|一把屎，一把尿|不拉屎的|乾屎橛|占著茅坑不拉屎|吃了蜜蜂兒屎似的|嘴吃屎|好鞋不踏臭屎|屎棋|屎滾尿流|屎盆子|屎蚵蜋|屎蛋|屎頭巾|拉硬屎|攬狗屎|燥屎|狗吃屎|狗吃熱屎|狗屎堆|狗攬三堆屎|道在屎溺|阿屎|雞屎藤|鳥不生蛋，狗不拉屎|攪屎棍}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くそ}}
From {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*kuso}}. Cognate with {{m|ja|臭い|tr=kusai||stinky, smelly}}, {{m|ja|腐る|tr=kusaru||to rot, to become stinky}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Derived terms
Idioms
Usage notes
subSections.text: This is not considered as profane as the English glosses. For instance, a child of five using the Japanese interjection ''kuso'' would be unremarkable, whereas it would be very socially inappropriate for a child of five to use the English interjection {{m|en|shit}}.

subSections.title: Prefix
Suffix
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ばば}}
Appears to derive from [[baby talk]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> Compare {{cog|en|poopoo}}.
